channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: They Seek to Curb Online Hate. The U.S. Accuses Them of Censorship.
item.description: The Trump administration said five regulators and researchers who work to tackle disinformation and abuse on the internet had been barred from enterin...

item.title: American Jews, Chinese food and Christmas: The first connection was a 1935 gift of chow mein to a New Jersey orphanage
item.description: Elena Kagan was asked where she was on Christmas during her Supreme Court confirmation: “Like all Jews, I was probably at a Chinese restaurant.”

item.title: CEO of a $134 billion software giant blasts companies with billions in funding but zero revenue: ‘That’s clearly a bubble, right… it’s, like, insane’
item.description: Databricks CEO Ali Ghodsi says he's hearing from venture capitalists "maybe I should just go on a break for, like, six months" to let the bubble simme...

item.title: The Powerball prize now stands at $1.7 billion. Here are the biggest jackpots in history—and where the winning tickets were sold
item.description: The U.S. has seen more than a dozen lottery jackpot prizes exceed $1 billion since 2016.

item.title: How investment giant Vanguard’s CIO is placing big tech bets today to create the AI digital advisor of tomorrow
item.description: Vanguard CIO Nitin Tandon says AI can be used to hyper-personalize guidance for customers.

item.title: Pennsylvania Nursing Home Explosion Kills 2
item.description: A resident and an employee were killed after two explosions at the Bristol Health and Rehab Center resulted in a large fire and partial collapse of th...

item.title: Rain Begins in Southern California as Region Braces for Intense Storm
item.description: Heavy rain, strong winds, flooding and debris flow could affect Los Angeles County and the surrounding areas on Christmas Eve and Christmas Day.

item.title: Long Carrier Deployment Projects Strength in U.S. Pressure Campaign on Venezuela, and Carries Costs
item.description: The U.S.S. Ford has been deployed for six months, now in the Caribbean as part of President Trump’s pressure campaign on Venezuela. Maintenance woes a...

item.title: The K-shaped economy is carrying a ticking time bomb into 2026
item.description: "I've never seen anything like it," KPMG's chief economist Diane Swonk told Fortune.

item.title: Former Fire Boss, Who Is Jewish, Wants to Move on From Mamdani Criticism
item.description: Zohran Mamdani chose Lillian Bonsignore to be fire commissioner, weeks after the former commissioner, Robert S. Tucker, resigned, citing Mr. Mamdani’s...

item.title: The Truce Is 2 Months Old. So Why Have Hundreds of Gazans Been Killed?
item.description: Since the cease-fire took effect, Israel says it has targeted only militants. But death can come for Gazans while on a family outing or sleeping in a ...

item.title: Blast Kills Three in Moscow Near Site of General’s Car Bombing
item.description: Two police officers died in the explosion, the authorities said. Earlier this week a car bomb killed a military commander in the same area of Russia’s...

item.title: Zelensky Open to Pulling Back Troops in Eastern Ukraine to Reach Peace Deal With Russia
item.description: The offer was the closest Mr. Zelensky has come to addressing the thorny territorial disputes in Donetsk that have repeatedly derailed peace talks.

item.title: The Strange Case of the Russian Snickers in U.K. Convenience Shops
item.description: The Russian-labeled candy bars are a reminder of how difficult it is to completely disconnect a major economy from the global flow of goods.

item.title: Here’s What Is in the 20-Point Peace Plan for Ukraine
